meanings.definition: The act of creating a replica or imitation of something.
meanings.sent1: She practiced dummying her signature for the autograph session.
meanings.sent2: The artist was dummying a sculpture of a famous landmark.
meanings.sent3: The kids were dummying a pretend tea party with their toys.
meanings.sent4: His dummying of the ancient artifact was so accurate, it fooled many experts.
meanings.sent5: The dummying of the painting made it hard to distinguish from the original.

meanings.definition: The act of pretending or feigning.
meanings.sent1: During the play, the actor's dummying of sadness brought tears to the audience.
meanings.sent2: She was caught dummying surprise when her friends threw her a surprise party.
meanings.sent3: The dog was dummying sleep to trick the cat into getting closer.
meanings.sent4: His dummying of confidence was so convincing, no one suspected his nerves.
meanings.sent5: The child's dummying of being a superhero was adorable to watch.

meanings.definition: The act of making a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: Her dummying of the math problem led to the wrong answer.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's dummying of the punchline caused the audience to laugh even harder.
meanings.sent3: He kept dummying the dance steps, but he never lost his smile.
meanings.sent4: The chef's dummying of the recipe resulted in a surprisingly delicious dish.
meanings.sent5: The student's dummying of the historical date made the teacher chuckle.
